name: FAKE5
helpMarkDown: This task downloads and caches the FAKE runner and executes the FAKE 5 build script specified.
author: Matthias Dittrich

inputs.name: FakeVersion
inputs.label: Version of FAKE to download and use
inputs.helpMarkDown: The version of the fake runner to use. Needs to be >= 5 and this has no effect on the package versions your script uses.

inputs.name: FakeScript
inputs.label: Path to FAKE script
inputs.helpMarkDown: The path to the FAKE build script.

inputs.name: ScriptArguments
inputs.label: The command line arguments for the script
inputs.helpMarkDown: For example enter '--parallel 3 target Build' or '-t Build' to run a target called 'Build'. Enter '-s target Build' to run a target without dependencies.

inputs.name: WorkingDirectory
inputs.label: Working Directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: The working directory (defaults to the path of the script).

inputs.name: PreventSecrets
inputs.label: Prevent script to access secret variables
inputs.helpMarkDown: You can prevent the script from being able to access all secret variables. To forward single secret variables just use the -e switch to set environment variables.

inputs.name: FakeArguments
inputs.label: Set the complete fake command line
inputs.helpMarkDown: For example enter 'run build.fsx -s target Build' to run a single target called build. This replaces 'Path to FAKE script' and 'The command line arguments for the script'

inputs.name: FailOnStdError
inputs.label: Fail on standard error output.
inputs.helpMarkDown: Fail the build if something is printed to the standard-error stream.
